newsitem.title: USA: Onsite to boost number of common shares.
newsitem.headline: Onsite to boost number of common shares.

text.p: Onsite Energy Corp said on Friday its common shares would rise by about four million through shareholders' conversion of preferred stock.
The company said in a statement that a dividend reduction to earnings for Series A and B preferred stock before calculating the earnings per share totaled $608,438, or $0.09 per share.

For the quarter ended June 3O, the reduction totaled $152,110, or $0.02 per share. Those dividends will be in the form of stock and will result in the issuance of about 331,000 shares of Class A Common Stock.

"As a result of the negative impact the declaration of preferred dividends had on the per share earnings, the major shareholders of the Series A and Series B Preferred Stock have agreed to convert their preferred shares to common stock immediately," the statement said.

These shareholders represent 3,660 shares of the 3,810 Series A Preferred Stock and 588,045 of the 605,641 Series B Preferred Stock. The conversion ... will result in about four million additional shares of Class A common stock."
The company has about 6.6 million shares outstanding.
